pageHeader.title: Apply for unemployment benefits
pageHeader.subTitle: Have you lost your job?  You may qualify for temporary income to support you while you look for a new one

calloutTime.text: Most applicants hear back within 4-6 weeks of applying

paragraph.text: To apply for unemployment, you need to provide personal information including your Social Security number, birth date, home address, email address, and phone number.
You also need information about your employment history from the last 15 months, including:

unorderedList.text: Names of all employers, plus addresses and phone numbers
Recall date (if you were laid off but have a set date to return to work)

paragraph.text: You may need additional information in certain situations:

unorderedList.text: If you are not a U.S. citizen — your Alien Registration number
If you have children or other dependents — their birth dates and Social Security numbers
If you’re in a union — your union name and local number
If you were in the military — your DD-214 Member 4 form (optional). If you don’t have it, you can request your DD-214 online.
If you worked for the federal government — your SF8 form (optional)

paragraph.text: To receive payments by direct deposit, you’ll also need your bank account details and routing number. Otherwise, DUA will send you a debit card.

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: In Person at State Parks

paragraph.text: Most parks and beaches that charge daily parking fees sell MassParks Passes at their contact stations during their paid parking seasons. Just ask to purchase a MassParks Pass and show your driver’s license or proof of residency. Please note: most parks cannot accept credit cards, so you’ll have to pay with cash or a check.

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: Some Other Method

paragraph.text: If you concentrate really hard, a pass might magically appear in front of you

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: Online

paragraph.text: You can also order a MassParks pass online through Reserve America. There is an additional $2.75 charge to use this online service. Your pass will be mailed to your home within seven days.

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: By Phone

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: By Mail

paragraph.text:
(only if you're purchasing a Senior MassParks Pass)
Senior MassParks Passes can be purchased by mail by writing to the following address:

DCR MassParks
251 Causeway Street
Boston, MA 02114
Attn: Senior MassParks Pass Coordinator

and including a photocopy of your MA driver’s license or other official proof of MA residency and age, and a check for $10 made payable to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

steps.accordionLabel: Expand step for doing this in person
steps.title: By Fax

unorderedList.text: Download and fill out an application for an EIN.

sublist.text: If you include your fax number, an EIN will be faxed to you within 4 business days.
